intro: Hieracium atricapillum, commonly known as the black-eyed Susan, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of dark brown or black tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. It is often found in meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges.
